column4: guys, could you help me wit non-working ethernet on my notebook on ubuntu 12.04?
So you plugged in your cat5 cable, and you have no internet?
yes, i plug it into and it's typing "getting network adress" after second "network cable disconnected"
Did it work before Ubuntu? If so that would most likely eliminate a hardware issue.
Or try a different cable - same idea.
cable is working cause i use it on my PC (Xubuntu).
Okay, so the cable is working but we don't know about a different install on the same computer that is 'broken'?
i've installed windows xp and no result. but I'm downloading official windows 7 with new drivers support
So we're waiting for that? If you want to try to troubleshoot in the mean time.. pastebin the output of "ifconfig" paste.ubuntu.com
definitely not connected. I can't imagine your card isn't supported but how about you paste the output of lspci for me
I'm installing windows 7 now and after 40 minutes I 'll have to go, so I can do that later
Okay - track me down. If it doesn't work in windows you can likely assume it's a hardware issue.
my internet provider said it was problem with a driver. Bit I know Ubuntu has all the drivers
